p: A total of eight out of 15 planned sessions were delivered. Feedback on the scenarios indicate that participants ‘Strongly Agree’ (72 %) or ‘Agree’ (18 %) that the scenarios were useful and improved their understanding of the clinical subject (Strongly Agree 60 %, Agree 40 %). They also ‘Strongly Agree’ (50 %) or ‘Agree’ (50 %) that discussion of the non-clinical aspects of the scenarios was useful. When asked to identify one thing they learnt from each scenario, multiple respondents identified non-technical aspects such as the importance of communication within the team, situational awareness and closed loop feedback.
